Class AIEasy

java.lang.Object
AIEasy
All Implemented Interfaces:
gameLogicInterface
public class AIEasy
extends java.lang.Object
implements gameLogicInterface

AIEasy

The AIEasy class implements the easy mode for playing against AI by firing randomly at the players board.

    • Loop

      public boolean Loop​(Board playerBoard, Board other, getUserInput UI, BoardPrinterWrapper player1Printer, BoardPrinterWrapper player2Printer)
      Calls markBoard to loop through the steps of the game if either player hasn't lost all their ships
      Specified by:
      Loop in interface gameLogicInterface
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - - board of player
      other - - board of opponent
      UI - - getUserInput
      playerPrinter - - BoardPrinterWrapper object of players board
      player2Printer - - Board PrinterWrapper object of AI board
      Returns:
      boolean - returns true if either player still has ships, returns false when someone loses.

      col - - int that holds number of columns

    • markRandom

      private boolean markRandom​(int size)
      Marks a random coordinate on the board.
      Parameters:
      size - - int that holds size
      Returns:
      boolean - if the random coordinate matches with a ship coordinate, returns true. Else, returns false

    • isHit

      private boolean isHit​(int row, int col, char letter)
      checks if a ship has been hit
      Parameters:
      row - - int that holds number of rows
      col - - int that holds number of columns
      letter - - char that holds the letter that a coordinate gets compared to
      Returns:
      boolean - if the coordinate and letter match, returns true. Else, return false
